greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least prime p such that n = p + q - r for some primes q and r with q > p.
comment: p = 3 when n is an odd nonprime and p = 2 otherwise, so that 3 appears in positions given by A014076.
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: t = Join[{{1, {3, 5, 7}}, {2, {2, 3, 3}}}, Table[If[PrimeQ[n], {n, {2, n, 2}}, p = If[EvenQ[2 + NextPrime[n, 1] - n], 3, 2]; NestWhile[# + 1 &, 1, ! PrimeQ[r = (p + (q = NextPrime[n, #])) - n] &]; {n, {p, q, r}}], {n, 3, 300}]];
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 26 2016
